text: Yoel Sola Cariñanos (born 10 April 1992) is a Spanish footballer who plays for CD Izarra as a midfielder. ==Club career== Born in Pamplona, Navarre, Sola made his senior debuts with UDC Chantrea in 2011, in Tercera División. In the 2012 summer he moved to Segunda División B's CD Peña Sport,Mercado de fichajes: Segunda B (Transfer market: Segunda B); Navarra Fútbol Clic, 25 June 2012 appearing regularly for the club and scoring seven goals.Resumen de la temporada 2012/2013: Objetivo cumplido (Summary of the 2012/2013 season: Objective accomplished); Peña Sport's official website, 19 July 2013 On 16 February 2013 Sola agreed a deal with CA Osasuna, being effective in June.Osasuna ficha a Yoel Sola para la próxima temporada (Osasuna signs Yoel Sola for the following season); La Segunda B, 16 February 2013 He was assigned to the reserves in the fourth level. On 18 March 2015 Sola made his first-team debut, starting in a 0–3 away loss against Deportivo Alavés for the Segunda División championship.El Alavés arrolla a Osasuna para escalar hasta la octava plaza (Alavés overwhelms Osasuna to climb up to the eight place); Marca, 18 March 2015 On 21 July he moved to CD Izarra, in the third tier.Primer entrenamiento del equipo, Entrevista al mister y las nuevas incorporaciones al equipo (First training from the team, manager's interview and the new additions); Izarra's official website, 21 July 2015 ==References== ==External links== * * * Category:1992 births Category:Living people Category:Footballers from Pamplona Category:Spanish footballers Category:Association football midfielders Category:Segunda División players Category:Segunda División B players Category:Tercera División players Category:CA Osasuna B players Category:CA Osasuna players Category:CD Izarra footballers
title: Yoel Sola
